intro: Lansbergia purgans, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, star-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Lansbergia purgans is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions.
